page.title: 10A Small Farm in Water
page.content: Waterhouse Farm, a typical small holding, was built in 1700,with additional buildings added up to 1976. The farm had once been very large and would have supported one or two families, but typical of many farms in the area, large parcels of land have been sold leaving 6 acres of rough grazing and hay meadow. The farm at present is unable to support a family. There are 8 cattle, 11 hens,one cock and two goats all looked after as a hobby rather than for economic returns. The farmhouse is in the process of renovation as are many in the area. Composed of stone with a new tile roof the farmhouse commands a SSE position and has good access to the village and excellant views. Main water is available to the house as well as spring water.
